featured.text: The mind and body work together to produce stress, which is a bodily response to a stimulus, a response that disturbs the body’s normal physiological balance.
Only a third of people are disturbed by the song in their heads.

Furthermore, watching horror movies can disturb sleep patterns, as the residual fear and anxiety they evoke may keep people awake all night, thus leading to fatigue and irritability the following day.
There never seemed to be enough time to go to church, which disturbed some friends and relatives.

other.text: Generally speaking, our biological clock is slightly disturbed if we just move into the next time zone, but jet lag becomes a problem once we have passed through three or four time zones.
It is a rather threatening lullaby, in which the baby is scolded for disturbing the house god with its crying and warned of terrifying consequences.

definition.en_def: To interfere with the normal arrangement or functioning of something; to cause someone to feel anxious or upset.
definition.example: Please do not disturb me while I am studying.
